quizInfo.Subject: Integrative Programming
quizInfo.Title: .NET Framework
References: Any external links/handouts should be referenced here

quizData.question: An object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft in the 1990s and is often used to code apps on Windows OS.
C# allows users to develop mobile applications.
It is a collection of tools, technologies, and languages that provides an environment to build and deploy applications easily.
This controls the tasks and manage system resources of the computer.
This is a runtime environment of the .NET framework that manages the execution of the .NET code.
CLR converts and compiles the source code into this language that is essentially a portable assembly code.
This the name of the compiler that combines MSIL code into a machine-language one before it's executed.

This is a library that contains the classes and interfaces that is used for building applications. The classes in this library can be used to build and interact with ASP.NET, Windows Forms, and ADO.NET.
This is a component that provides access to relational databases such as SQL and XML.
This is a unified web development model that includes the services necessary in building enterprise-class web apps.
This component of ASP.NET allows the user to build dynamic websites using a familiar drag-and drop event-driven model.
This component of ASP.NET extends the web infrastructure to provide the means for software to conenct to other apps.
This component of ASP.NET component contains graphical representation of any window displayed in the app.
This is a set of basic language features that ensures oeprability between languages in the .NET environment.
This is a formal specification that documents how types are declared, used, and managed so that it's subset, the CLR, can use it.
The following languages are supported by .NET EXCEPT for one.
This feature of the .NET framework states that it includes a large library and supports several programming languages that allow developers to write code in different languages.
This is supported by the .NET framework that is used by developers in creating highly responsive web apps with minimal effort.
It is a colelction of types and resources that are built to work together and form a logical unit of functionality.
Applications in .NET are deployed as an assembly.
What word in this statement makes it THE STATEMENT IS FALSE ? : The entire .NET code on execution is converted into an intermediate language code and is stored as an assembly.
A module that contains functions and data that can be used by another module.
This is contained in an assembly that provides information along with a complete list and description of methods, types, and other resources.
Part of the metadata is a list of identification information, and other assemblies that is used by the current assembly.
How many bits does a version number contain in each assembly which is presented as a set of four decimal pieces (Major.Minor.Build.Revision).
Multiple applications can use a shared assembly, while a private assembly only gives access to one single application.
This stores assemblies specifically designated to be shared by several applications on the computer.
This type of assembly can have multiple versions that are not backwards compatible with each other.
This type of assembly requires a registration in the Global Assembly Cache (GAC).
This declaration is a collection of classes.
Every C# application can contain multiple Main methods.
Statements and expressions in C# doesn't necessarily need to end in a semicolon.
